intro: Staphylosyce barteri, commonly known as the Barter's staphylosyce, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive tubular flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features include opposite leaves and showy, two-lipped flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
